definition: poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
poor but with great ambitions (idiom)/poor but principled

sentences.english: We weren't poor. But we always had modest Christmases.
sentences.chinese: 我们家并不穷，但我们的圣诞礼物总是很有节制。

sentences.english: The surprise is to emerge in endlessly more in lifestyle field.
sentences.chinese: 其实在生活方式领域，这样的惊喜更是曾出不穷。

sentences.english: A small family, very ordinary, not poor or rich.
sentences.chinese: 一个小家庭，非常普通，不穷也不富。

sentences.english: Or shake a little bit poor, to truly shake the non-poor.
sentences.chinese: 还是有点穷摇，来个真正不穷摇的。

sentences.english: No, I’m not poor, but thanks for your concern.
sentences.chinese: 不，我不穷，但还是谢谢你的关心。

sentences.english: Nowadays the cases about trademark fair use become more than before.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，关于商标合理使用的案例曾出不穷。

sentences.english: While he was not poor, he had no ready cash.

definition: more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
brilliant and varied/(often in the combination 精彩纷呈)
to make new advances/to move forwards
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
to emerge in large numbers/to spring up/to emerge prominently
